frontmatter.title: When would writers use multimodal composition?

points.point:
Most people are already composing multimodally. In fact, most of us are doing it all the time: when we text, when we share photos or videos, when we ❤️ somebody else’s photos or videos. 

But ❤️ isn’t always effective. Usually it doesn’t work in a résumé, a business letter, or a research paper. So, given the range of multimodal choices available: when might writers use them?

[Abby’s lab report (includes chemical molecules!)](https://doi.org/10.3998/mpub.10079890.cmp.139)

[Abby’s scientific research poster (includes graphs and photographs)](https://doi.org/10.3998/mpub.10079890.cmp.141)

[Kaitlin’s essay (includes graphics)](https://doi.org/10.3998/mpub.10079890.cmp.162)

[Julia’s capstone e-portfolio](https://www.fulcrum.org/concern/file_sets/qj72p802g)
points.title: When do we use multimodal composition?

points.point:
There are some guidelines writers can use for multimodal composition. First, who is the audience and what is the composing situation? For instance, a photograph of you and your friends at the pool might seem out of place when writing to a prospective employer, but might be perfect for your followers on Instagram.

Sometimes the situation isn’t so clear. A popular meme might be the best way to make a point in a classroom presentation, or it might not.

Sophie explains the usefulness of Prezi for persuading an audience:

:::md-component ExpandableBlockquote previewText="I%20think%20it%27s%20%5BPrezi%u2019s%5D%20really%20fun%2C%20%u2026" fullText="%5BI%20think%20it%27s%20%5C%5BPrezi%u2019s%5D%20really%20fun%2C%20but%20it%20looks%20so%20visually%20appealing%20and%20for%20a%20class%20where%20you%27re%20trying%20to%20persuade%20people%20of%20something%2C%20that%27s%20half%20the%20battle%20is%20just%20getting%20them%20to%20look%20at%20what%20you%27re%20trying%20to%20say.%20So%2C%20yeah%2C%20there%20hasn%27t%20really%20been%20that%20much%20writing%20necessarily%2C%20that%27s%20gone%20into%20that%20class%2C%20it%27s%20more%20just%20been%u2014well%20actually%2C%20we%27re%20one%20of%20the%20first%20groups%20to%20go.%20The%20presentations%20span%20over%20like%20the%20course%20of%20a%20month%2C%20and%20we%27re%20the%20first%20day%2C%20so%20we%20haven%27t%20had%20that%20much%20time%20to%20prepare%2C%20but%20it%27s%20been%20really%20interesting%20and%20I%20think%20that%20the%20Prezi%20definitely%20is%20going%20to%20add%20something%u2026%20We%20had%20this%20one%20map%20that%20we%27re%20showing%20and%20then%20we%20want%20to%20show%20another%20map%20next%20to%20it%20and%2C%20rather%20than%20clicking%20on%20the%20next%20slide%2C%20we%20just%20zoom%20out%2C%20and%20you%20can%20see%20both%20maps%20next%20to%20each%20other.%20Which%2C%20when%20you%27re%20watching%20something%2C%20it%27s%20just%20much%20more%20visually%20appealing.%20Not%20to%20say%20that%20PowerPoint%20doesn%27t%20get%20the%20job%20done%2C%20because%20it%20does%20if%20you%20just%20want%20words%20on%20a%20screen%2C%20it%27s%20more%20than%20okay.%5D%28https%3A//hdl.handle.net/2027/fulcrum.10079890/poi.13%29"

You can also read more of what Sophie says about it [here](https://doi.org/10.3998/mpub.10079890.cmp.45)
points.title: How should we use multimodal composition?

points.point:
Writers also need to know which multimodal choices are available: graphs or charts, drawings or photos, audio, video, or infographics. In this situation, a student wanted to discuss a piece of popular music, and had to choose the best way to make her case:

:::md-component ExpandableBlockquote previewText="I%20chose%20a%20piece%20that%20I%20wrote%20for%20%5BEnglish%20course%5D%20on%20the%20%5BRapper%5D%20Song.%20%u2026" fullText="%5BI%20chose%20a%20piece%20that%20I%20wrote%20for%20%5C%5BEnglish%20course%5D%20on%20the%20%5C%5BRapper%5D%20Song.%20It%20was%20an%20essay%20that%20I%20wrote%20an%20actual%20song.%20I%20thought%20that%20I%20wasted%20a%20lot%20of%20time%20in%20the%20essay%20explaining%20how%20the%20music%20sounded%20or%20what%20the%20lyrics%20said.%20I%20made%20an%20audio%20essay%20of%20it%2C%20with%20me%20reading%20it%20and%20then%20it%20cut%20into%20the%20actual%20music.%20That%20was%20something%20that%20couldn%u2019t%20have%20been%20done%20without%20new%20media.%5D%28https%3A//hdl.handle.net/2027/fulcrum.10079890/poi.16%29"

You can also read more of what Dana says in her interview about it [here](https://doi.org/10.3998/mpub.10079890.cmp.109)
points.title: Which multimodal choices are available?

points.point:
Writers should be sure to 

* Avoid using multimodal elements as decoration
* Clarify the relationship between multimodal elements and the message the piece tries to deliver
* Consider how multimodal elements can deliver substance.

[Click here to read](https://doi.org/10.3998/mpub.10079890.cmp.21) about how Lauren decides to use multimodal elements:

:::md-component ExpandableBlockquote previewText="It%u2019s%20cool%20because%20I%20can%20express%20myself%20in%20a%20medium%20other%20than%20words%2C%20%u2026." fullText="%5BIt%u2019s%20cool%20because%20I%20can%20express%20myself%20in%20a%20medium%20other%20than%20words%2C%20but%20I%20can%20still%20express%20the%20same%20ideas%20that%20I%u2019m%20writing%20about.%20I%20mean%2C%20I%u2019m%20like%u2014for%20my%20SAC%20%5C%5BScreen%20Arts%20and%20Culture%5D%20290%20class%2C%20we%20are%20doing%20black%20and%20white%2016mm%20silent%20film%2C%20so%20it%u2019s%20really%20cool%20cause%20we%20had%20like%20somebody%20playing%20chess%u2014two%20guys%20playing%20chess%u2014and%20it%20looked%20really%2C%20really%20gorgeous.%20It%20was%20like%2C%20%u2018I%20could%20write%20about%20this%2C%20but%20it%u2019s%20so%20much%20cooler%20to%20see%20it%20in%20this%20medium%2C%u2019%20and%20the%20way%20I%20choose%20to%20cut%20the%20angles%2C%20and%20where%20I%u2019m%20cutting%20for%20continuity%2C%20and%20stuff%20like%20that%2C%20that%20is%20kind%20of%20like%20writing%20in%20itself.%5D%28https%3A//hdl.handle.net/2027/fulcrum.10079890/poi.18%29"

**FOR INSTRUCTORS: Teachers who want multimodal composition need to invite it into their classrooms and assignments. For instance, specifying MLA or APA format and 12-point type, double-spaced does not encourage students to include maps, tables, graphs, or photos that could improve the text.**
points.title: What limitations are there to multimodal composition?

frontmatter.afterPoints: Multimodal composition means thinking about using a variety of tools to deliver messages effectively to an intended audience.
